comment.body:
> [googleceo](#comment_1_15SpA2pA6hoUAmPrz5rp75goP4cXxw7tau): "In ZeroNet.conf you'll want to add your ipv6 to the ip_external section." Do I choose this address freely? I have no IPv6 network here, but it should work anyway.

```ifconfig | grep "inet6 fc"``` command returns your cjdns ipv6 address. Or alternatively you can find it in your  cjdroute.conf file after ```"ipv6": ```

> [googleceo](#comment_3_15SpA2pA6hoUAmPrz5rp75goP4cXxw7tau): Thanks! You mean ifconfig | grep "inet6 addr: fc", the tun0 (tunnel) interface?

Yes, it's likely to be the only address started with "fc" and assigned to tun0 by default
>ifconfig | grep "inet6 addr: fc"

returns nothing in my case. It may depend on your OS or ifconfig version
